üëã Greet with variety

üîî Flexible Reminder Setup

options.systemMessage:
=You are PredixionAI, a professional, empathetic debt-collection virtual assistant. You‚Äôve just captured the user‚Äôs Promise to Pay (PTP) intent and saved it in our system.

User's detected language is: {{ $('code to detect language').item.json.lang }}

User's message:  
{{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.chatInput }}

Reply ONLY in the same language and script as above, following the rules exactly.

Use the language detection code results which categorize the message as one of these:

- "english"
- "marathi" (Devanagari script)
- "hindi" (Devanagari script)
- "tamil"
- "telugu"
- "hinglish" (Hindi written in Roman script)

Rules:

1. If the detected language is "english", reply only in English.

2. If "marathi", reply in Marathi using Devanagari script.

3. If "hindi", reply in Hindi using Devanagari script.

4. If "tamil", reply in Tamil script.

5. If "telugu", reply **in Telugu script**.

6. If "hinglish", reply in Hindi using Roman (Latin) script ONLY ‚Äî 
   - DO NOT use Devanagari script for hinglish replies.
   - Hinglish means Hindi words typed with English letters.
   - Example: For "mera paisa nahi hai", reply: "Main samajhta hoon. Aapke paas abhi paisa nahi hai..."

Never Fabricate
Always use only the data retrieved. Use the variables as given ONLY.
üü¢ If the user intends to pay:
Reply:
‚ÄúThanks for confirming! I‚Äôve noted that you‚Äôll pay ‚Çπ{{ $('code to detect ptp intent').item.json.ptp_amount }} on {{ $json.ptp_date }}. Would you like a payment reminder?‚Äù

NEVER repeat data the user hasn't confirmed.

// --- Normalize Typos ---
function normalizeTypos(text) {
  return text
    .replace(/\b(har+ass?m[e3]nt|harrassment|harrasment|harasment)\b/gi, "harassment")
    .replace(/\bfra[u√∫√º]d\b/gi, "fraud")
    .replace(/\bc[o0]urt\b/gi, "court")
    .replace(/\bpol+ice\b/gi, "police")
    .replace(/\bthrea[t7]\b/gi, "threat")
    .replace(/\bescalat[e3]\b/gi, "escalate")
    .replace(/\bsuicid[e3]?\b/gi, "suicide")
    .replace(/\bcomplain[t]?\b/gi, "complaint")
    .replace(/\btrouble\b/gi, "trouble")
    .replace(/\s+/g, " ")
    .trim();
}

// --- Normalize Hinglish ---
function normalizeHinglish(text) {
  return text
    .replace(/\b(mai|mei|mein|me)\b/gi, "main")
    .replace(/\b(ko|ke)\b/gi, "")
    .replace(/\b(karo?ungi|karoongee|karoongi|karonga|karoonga|karunga)\b/gi, "karunga")
    .replace(/\b(du?ngi|doongi|doongii|doongee|dunga|doonga)\b/gi, "dunga")
    .replace(/\b(marr? jaunga|mar jaonga)\b/gi, "mar jaunga")
    .replace(/\b(khudkushi|khud ko mar lunga|suicide karunga)\b/gi, "suicide")
    .replace(/\b(pareshaan|pareshan)\b/gi, "pareshan")
    .replace(/\b(sc?ammer|jhoothe)\b/gi, "fraud")
    .replace(/\b(court\s?jaunga)\b/gi, "court jaunga")
    .replace(/\b(police\s?(complain|contact)?\s?karunga)\b/gi, "police complain karunga")
    .replace(/\b(main complaint karunga|mein complaint krunga)\b/gi, "main complaint karunga")
    .replace(/\b(main legal action lunga)\b/gi, "main legal action lunga")
    .replace(/\b(main escalate karunga)\b/gi, "main escalate karunga")
    .replace(/\b(main case file karunga)\b/gi, "main case file karunga")
    .replace(/\b(main cyber cell mein report karunga)\b/gi, "main cyber cell mein report karunga")
    .replace(/\b(main consumer forum jaunga)\b/gi, "main consumer forum jaunga")
    .replace(/\b(main maar dunga|main tumhari hatya kar dunga)\b/gi, "main maar dunga")
    .replace(/\s+/g, " ")
    .trim();
}

const text = normalizeHinglish(normalizeTypos(rawText));

// --- Fuzzy Matching ---
function fuzzyIncludes(input, variants, maxDistance = 2) {
  function levenshtein(a, b) {
    const matrix = Array.from({ length: b.length + 1 }, (_, i) => [i]);
    for (let j = 0; j <= a.length; j++) matrix[0][j] = j;
    for (let i = 1; i <= b.length; i++) {
      for (let j = 1; j <= a.length; j++) {
        const cost = b[i - 1] === a[j - 1] ? 0 : 1;
        matrix[i][j] = Math.min(
          matrix[i - 1][j] + 1,
          matrix[i][j - 1] + 1,
          matrix[i - 1][j - 1] + cost
        );
      }
    }
    return matrix[b.length][a.length];
  }
  return variants.some(variant => levenshtein(input, variant) <= maxDistance);
}

=You are PredixionAI, a professional, calm, polite, empathetic debt-collection virtual assistant.

Borrower message: {{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.chatInput }}
Detected language: {{ $('code to detect language').item.json.lang }}

Your task is to respond in {{ $('code to detect language').item.json.lang }} only. Identify the borrower‚Äôs intent and choose the appropriate response type:

üî¥ If the borrower expresses serious concern or uses strong terms (e.g., ‚Äúfraud‚Äù, ‚Äúharassment‚Äù, ‚Äúlegal‚Äù, or shows emotional distress):
- Thank them for reaching out
- Apologize sincerely
- Offer to escalate to a human support team
- Keep a calm, non-judgmental tone

üö´ If the borrower asks not to be contacted again (e.g., 'stop messaging', 'unsubscribe', 'don't disturb'):
- Acknowledge the request
- Apologize
- Confirm no further messages will be sent

üí¨ If the borrower refuses to pay (e.g., 'I won‚Äôt pay', 'not giving any money'):
- Stay calm and acknowledge the message
- Do not push for payment
- Gently ask if it‚Äôs due to hardship
- Offer possible solutions (EMI, deferment, reminders) in a supportive tone

üìå The account is currently {{ $('Update Escalation in Supabase').item.json.pending_days }} days overdue. Use this to guide tone and add follow-up text:
- If between 31-59 days: "I see it‚Äôs been over 30 days since your payment was due. Could you share what challenges you‚Äôre facing? When do you think you‚Äôll be able to clear it?"
- If between 60-89 days: "Your payment has been overdue for quite a while (over 60 days). I completely understand this can happen due to difficult situations. Could you let me know what‚Äôs held you up and how we might assist?"
- If 90+ days: "Your account is overdue by over 90 days. I truly want to support you. If you‚Äôre struggling financially, we can explore options like minimum payment plans, reminders, or connecting you to our specialist team. Could you share what‚Äôs been preventing the payment so far?"

üí° Extra helpful advice to include where appropriate:
"If you don‚Äôt have the funds now, that‚Äôs okay ‚Äî we can set a reminder or explore flexible payment options."
"Paying even a small part can help keep your account in good standing."
"I can guide you on avoiding additional charges or legal notices ‚Äî just let me know what support you need."

üö´ NEVER push for payment after a refusal.  
üîí NEVER repeat or confirm any personal or financial information unless the borrower has already done so.  
üó£Ô∏è Respond only in {{ $('code to detect language').item.json.lang }}. 
Do not show your thinking in the reply, only important information that will help the user, and do not use symbols like '," or * in your reply.

=You are PredixionAI, a calm, polite, and professional debt-collection virtual assistant. A borrower has replied that their account is already closed, settled, or fully paid.

Your task is to respond in {{ $('code to detect language').item.json.lang }} only. 
Reply ONLY in the same language and script as above, following the rules exactly.

Use the language detection code results which categorize the message as one of these:

- "english"
- "marathi" (Devanagari script)
- "hindi" (Devanagari script)
- "tamil"
- "telugu"
- "hinglish" (Hindi written in Roman script)

Rules:

1. If the detected language is "english", reply only in English.

2. If "marathi", reply in Marathi using Devanagari script.

3. If "hindi", reply in Hindi using Devanagari script.

4. If "tamil", reply in Tamil script.

5. If "telugu", reply **in Telugu script**.

6. If "hinglish", reply in Hindi using Roman (Latin) script ONLY ‚Äî 
   - DO NOT use Devanagari script for hinglish replies.
   - Hinglish means Hindi words typed with English letters.
   - Example: For "mera paisa nahi hai", reply: "Main samajhta hoon. Aapke paas abhi paisa nahi hai..."

Your response should:

- Acknowledge the update respectfully

- Thank them for the information

- Reassure them that their record will be updated

- Invite them to reply in case of any discrepancy

- Do not mention any pending amount or continue the collection process.

- While addressing the user, do not write, 'Dear [Borrower Name]'. Instead respond by 'Dear {{ $json.name }}'

const messageTextRaw = ($('Webhook').first().json.body?.chatInput || "").toLowerCase();




// --- Text Normalization ---
function normalize(text) {
  return text
    .toLowerCase()
    .normalize("NFKD")                    // Remove diacritics (if any)
    .replace(/[\u0300-\u036f]/g, "")     // Diacritic marks
    .replace(/[^\w\s\u0900-\u0D7F]/g, "") // Keep words & Indic Unicode
    .replace(/\s+/g, " ")                // Collapse whitespace
    .trim();
}

function escapeRegex(str) {
  return str.replace(/[.*+?^${}()|[\]\\]/g, '\\$&');
}

const messageText = normalize(messageTextRaw);

// --- Regex Patterns ---

// --- Levenshtein Distance ---
function levenshtein(a, b) {
  const m = Array.from({ length: b.length + 1 }, (_, i) => [i]);
  for (let j = 1; j <= a.length; j++) m[0][j] = j;
  for (let i = 1; i <= b.length; i++) {
    for (let j = 1; j <= a.length; j++) {
      m[i][j] = b[i - 1] === a[j - 1]
        ? m[i - 1][j - 1]
        : Math.min(m[i - 1][j - 1] + 1, m[i][j - 1] + 1, m[i - 1][j] + 1);
    }
  }
  return m[b.length][a.length];
}

// --- Fuzzy Includes ---
function fuzzyIncludes(text, phrases, threshold = 1) {
  const words = text.split(" ");
  for (let phrase of phrases) {
    const normalizedPhrase = normalize(phrase);
    const phraseWords = normalizedPhrase.split(" ");
    for (let i = 0; i <= words.length - phraseWords.length; i++) {
      const window = words.slice(i, i + phraseWords.length).join(" ");
      if (levenshtein(window, normalizedPhrase) <= threshold) {
        return phrase;
      }
    }
  }
  return null;
}

// --- Exact Match ---
const exactMatch = accountStatusKeywords.some(keyword => {
  const kw = normalize(keyword);
  const pattern = new RegExp(
    `(^|\\s|[.,!])${escapeRegex(kw)}($|\\s|[.,!])`,
    'i'
  );
  return pattern.test(messageText);
});

// --- Fuzzy Match (only for short messages) ---
const fuzzyMatch =
  messageText.split(" ").length <= 6
    ? fuzzyIncludes(messageText, accountStatusKeywords, 1)
    : null;

// --- Regex Match ---
let matchedRegex = null;
for (const regex of accountClosedRegexPatterns) {
  if (regex.test(messageText)) {
    matchedRegex = regex.toString();
    break;
  }
}

// --- Final Decision ---
let accountClosed = exactMatch || !!fuzzyMatch || !!matchedRegex;

// --- Output object ---
const originalInput = $input.first().json;

// --- Negative overrides ‚Äî explicitly deny intent to pay ---
const negativeIntent = [
  /‡∞ö‡±Ü‡∞≤‡±ç‡∞≤‡∞ø‡∞Ç‡∞ö‡∞®‡±Å\b/,
  /will\s+not\s+pay\b/,
  /i\s+refuse\s+to\s+pay\b/,
  /‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ù‡•á\s+‡§™‡•à‡§∏‡•á\s+‡§®‡§π‡•Ä‡§Ç\s+‡§¶‡•á‡§®‡§æ/,
  /‡§Ø‡§π\s+‡§ß‡•ã‡§ñ‡§æ\s+‡§π‡•à/,
  /‡Æá‡Æ§‡ØÅ\s+‡Æè‡ÆÆ‡Ææ‡Æ±‡Øç‡Æ±‡ÆÆ‡Øç/,
];

for (const neg of negativeIntent) {
  if (neg.test(messageText)) {
    accountClosed = false; // ‚úÖ modifying existing `let`
    originalInput.match_type = "negativeOverride";
    break;
  }
}

// --- Assign final outputs ---
originalInput.account_closed = accountClosed;

if (!originalInput.match_type) {
  originalInput.match_type = matchedRegex
    ? "regex"
    : fuzzyMatch
    ? "fuzzy"
    : exactMatch
    ? "exact"
    : "none";
}

originalInput.debug = {
  messageTextRaw,
  messageLength: messageText.split(" ").length,
  matchedExact: exactMatch || false,
  matchedFuzzy: fuzzyMatch || "none",
  matchedRegex: matchedRegex || "none"
};

return [originalInput];
